verses.verse: Then I looked and lo, a Lamb stood on Mount Zion and with him a hundred forty-four thousand having his Father's name written on their foreheads.
I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters and loud thunder. I also heard the sound of harpists playing their harps and singing
as if it were a new song before of the throne, the four living creatures, and the elders. No one could learn that song except the hundred forty-four thousand who were redeemed from the earth.

These are those who were not defiled with women, for they are virgins. These are those who follow the Lamb wheresoever he goes. These were redeemed from among men, first fruits to God and to the Lamb.
No deceit was found in their mouth, for they are blameless in the presence of God's throne.
Then I saw another angel fly through mid sky having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who live on the earth, to every nation, tribe, language, and people,
saying with a loud voice, "Fear God and give honor to him, because the time of his judgment is come. Worship him who made heaven, the earth, the sea, and springs of water."
Another angel followed saying, "Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink the wine of the passion of her fornication."
A third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, "If any one worships the beast and his statue and receives [his] mark on his forehead or his hand,
that one will drink the wine of God's wrath, which is poured undiluted into his cup of fiery anger. He will also be tormented with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and of the Lamb.
The smoke of their torment rises forever and ever, and they who worship the beast and his statue and receive the mark of his name have no rest day or night."
Here is the patience of God's people. Here are those who obey God's commandments and the faith of Jesus.

Next I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, "Write. Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on. Yes," says the Spirit, "that they may rest from their labors, and their actions do follow them."
I looked and lo, a white cloud and on this white cloud sat one similar to the Son of Man, having a gold crown on his head and a sharp scythe in his hand.

Another angel came out of the temple, shouting with a loud voice to him who sat on the cloud, "Thrust in your scythe and reap, for the time has come for you to reap, because the harvest of the earth is ripe."
He who sat on the cloud thrust in his scythe to the earth; and the earth was reaped.
Another angel came out of the temple, which is in heaven; he also had a sharp sickle.

Still another angel came from the altar, who had authority over the fire, and shouted loudly to him who had the sharp scythe saying, "Thrust in your sharp scythe and gather the clusters from the vine of the earth, for her grapes are fully ripe."
So the angel thrust in his scythe to the earth and gathered the vine of the earth and threw it into the great winepress of the furious anger of God.
The winepress was trodden outside the city, and blood came out of the winepress up to the horse's bridles for the length of one thousand six hundred stades (183 miles).
